info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 22 at 6:42PM CDT by NWS Marquette MI
info.description:
...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Michigan...
Paint River at Crystal Falls (Paint) affecting Iron County.
* WHAT...Elevated river levels caused by rain and snowmelt continue.
* WHERE...Paint River at Crystal Falls (Paint).
* WHEN...Until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 5.0 feet, At 5 feet the lowest portions of the Robert Olson Walking Trail begin to flood At 5.5 feet, 3500 - cfs - River exceeds bankfull stage At 7.0 feet, 5600 - cfs - Waterfront park areas near the M-69 bridge and low lying areas along the river in Crystal Falls become inundated.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:10 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 5.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 5.5 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette.
The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1100 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
